{"step_by_step_thinking": "Document [0] states that a patient's self-reported health-related quality of life provides independent prognostic information for survival in non-small cell lung cancer patients. Document [1] also supports this by stating that overall quality of life measured at the time of lung cancer diagnosis is a significant and independent prognostic factor for survival in patients with lung cancer. Document [5] also supports this by stating that health-related quality of life score is a prognostic factor for overall survival in elderly patients with advanced non-small-cell lung cancer. Therefore, it is clear that a patient's self-reported health-related quality of life is a prognostic factor for survival in non-small-cell lung cancer patients.", "answer_choice": "A"}
